required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: D-chiroinositol Administration for Testosterone Level Improvement in Hypogonadal Males

brief_summary.textblock: D-chiroinositol (DCI), is known as second messenger of insulin pathway, but recently several works have reported the influence of DCI on steroidogenesis. In particular, the DCI capabilities to regulate aromatase expression and testosterone biosynthesis are arising. In this regard, DCI administration in case of reduced levels of testosterone, could be a good therapeutic opportunity. For this reason, the treatment of Late-Onset Male Hypogonadism (LOH) in undoubtedly an interesting target. LOH is a reduction of testosterone level due to advancing age, currently treated with Testosterone Replacement Therapy (TRT). Unfortunately, there is a lack of information about TRT safety, especially in older men. For these reasons, the aim of this study is to evaluate the effect of DCI treatment on testosterone accumulation in LOH patient.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Serum Testosterone at 1 month
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Level of testosterone detected in the blood in ng/dL

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Weight at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Body weight of patients reported in kg

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Waist circumference at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Waist circumference of patients reported in cm

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline BMI at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Body Mass Index of patients calculated as kg/m2, where kg is the weight measured for eah patient while m2 is his height squared

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Insulin at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Level of fasting insulin detected in the blood and reported in microU/L

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Glycaemia at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Level of fasting glycaemia detected in the blood and reported in mg/dL

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline HOMA index at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: HOMA index known as Homeostatic Model Assessment for Insulin Resistance is: (fasting glycaemia x fasting insulin)/405

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Androstenedione at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Level of androstenedione detected in the blood and reported in ng/mL

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Luteinizing Hormone at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Level of luteinizing hormone detected in the blood and reported in mUI/ml

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Oestradiol at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Level of oestradiol detected in the blood and reported in pg/mL

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Oestrone at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Level of oestrone detected in the blood and reported in pg/mL

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Testosterone/Oestradiol ratio at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio between the levels of oestradiol and testosterone detected in the blood

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Strength Test at 1 month
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after 30 days of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of strength performed with the dominant hand using a hand-held dynamometer (Good Strength, IGS01, Metitur Oy, Jyväskylä, Finland) with the participant in the seated position with elbow flexed at 110°. The participant will be instructed to squeeze the handle as hard as possible for 3-5 seconds and the stregth will be recorded in kg

intervention.description: Supplementation with 600 mg of D-chiroinositol, two-times daily on an empty stomach, for 30 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men, with a diagnosis of Late-Onset Male Hypogonadism
- Insulin resistance (HOMA Index > 2,5)
- BMI between 25 and 30
Exclusion Criteria:
- Alcohol intake and/or drug abuse
- Recent hormonal treatment
- Smoking
- Obesity
- Systemic or endocrine diseases
- Male accessory gland infection
- Clinical history of cryptorchidism or varicocele and micro-orchidism
